item.title: Faces in the macOS photos library
item.description: My photo collection is a mess. Getting it under control has proven a challenge in terms of de-dupe, metadata cleanup and just general organization. I’ve tried numerous photo management apps and online backup strategies over the years. That’s resulted in many different backups scattered across various thumbdrives and SD cards. One such backup is a snapshot of the *.photoslibrary folder from my MacBook. This is where the builtin Photos.app (formerly iPhoto) stores files and metadata.
